Reviews.Title: “imagine staying in your best friends mansion--with room service, best location in rome!”
Reviews.Author: linda f
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to begin so....I’ll start at the beginning! I have been to Rome at least 25 times. This trip was just my daughter (18th birthday trip) and me. I wanted something a little different and not as expensive as the places I normally stay. My friend suggested Portrait Suites-- I was very nervous to try something new! The ONLY negative was the taxi driver who picked us up at the train station in Rome- He refused to drop us directly in front of the hotel. His response when i gave him the address was, "not possible, madam--too many people. I cannot drive there." We walked 2 blocks--which was annoying but fine. For future visits--either pre arrange with the hotel for a pick up or find a taxi driver not as difficult and temperamental as the one we had :) Upon arrival at the hotel--which is perfectly located Via Bocca De Leone (directly off of Via Del Condotti)-- we were greeted by the duo of the charming and professional Roberto and Thomas. After they showed us the beautiful hotel lobby, we were shown to our amazing duplex suite-- This is the type of room one sees in Architectural Digest! The bathroom was complete with a sauna, exercise bike, two beautiful marble sinks, separate bath and shower. The wood paneling was breathtaking--I would want it for my house! This hotel truly felt as though we were guests in a close friend's exquisite mansion. The attention to detail was everywhere in both design and service. The breakfast was delivered to our room on time and it was exactly as we asked. The hotel has a beautiful rooftop garden/terrace but the weather was a rainy in the morning. Roberto and Thomas made all of our dinner reservations--they didn't mind when we made several last minute changes:) In addition to the warm and hospitable nature of the hotel management--they went out of their way to accommodate me with some gluten free items I wanted to bring back home. Roberto went to the celiac store outside of the city and brought three huge boxes back to the hotel for me. It's expensive but I plan to stay at Portrait Suites when I return to Rome this summer, no need to stay any where else! --Perfecto! www.glutenfreeguy.com

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Deb P
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I prepare to travel I wind up spending hours researching hotels, trying to find the perfect place for us to call home on our journey. As usual I found several top-end hotels to explore and, also typically, my husband winced at the thought of paying their rates. When pushed to explain myself regarding my desire to stay in such expensive hotels I paused and said, "for me the hotel sets the tone for the trip." He couldn't argue with that. We had narrowed it down to two hotels: The Portrait Suites and another near by. There was something in the reviews, pictures, and descriptions of the Portrait Suites that kept pulling me in. I knew it's aesthetics were appealing to me and when the rates of the other hotel went up we booked our reservation at the Portrait Suites and I did a little happy dance. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the on staff manager, given a tour, taken to the terrace, and shown to our room. The decor and amenities in the room were just right. The Portrait Suites is a hotel for today-they provide each room with an iPad that's been loaded with lists of restaurants that the staff has personally been to & they provide a charging station for all of your personal gadgets. Great shower. Comfortable bed. Yummy pillows. Tiny kitchen tucked into a cabinet. The hotel is situated in the center of an exceptionally busy and high-end shopping district 1 block from the base of the Spanish Steps. With the windows shut silence was all we heard. The next morning we had our first breakfast on the roof top terrace. Wow! Now granted the weather was amazing but the terrace and the views from it were breathtaking. It was a little piece of paradise set amidst an absolutely beautiful backdrop of Rome. The food was great and the service impeccable. We took advantage of the terrace every evening, too-cocktails on the roof before dinner was a great way to cap our day. We spoke with the manager about our plans for the day and asked for suggestions for dinner. He made some notes and hooked us up with a great neighborhood Trattoria that night. This same scene was played out over the next 4 days and each suggestion hit the mark. I had expected the hotel and room to be fabulous but I hadn't given much thought to the hotel staff. Without a doubt the entire staff made our stay the exceptional experience that it was. Each and every person that worked at the Portrait Suites was helpful, positive, solicitous yet unobtrusive. I can't thank them enough. We spent three weeks in Italy and stayed in some amazing hotels. Without a doubt our favorite was the Portrait suites. If you have the chance to stay there do it. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Cort A
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our best hotel stay ever at the Portrait Suites in Rome. Upon arriving we were offered a cocktail and were then taken to the rooftop bar for some amazing views of Rome. The staff knew our names immediately upon arrival, and made you feel at home instantly. It really isn't a hotel but a very luxurious apartment house in the center of Rome. Our suite was spacious and very clean with every modern convenience at your finger tips. Unfortunately, we did not book our last night at the Portrait Suites and they were booked up, but they found us room on the same street near the Spanish Steps. We cannot say enough about our stay at the Portrait Suites. Thank you Rada and Franchesca and all of the staff for your help and kindness during our stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The ABSOLUTE BEST hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mickey K
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Rome. They know your name upon arrival, and make you feel at home from the second you step foot on the property. The hotel is literally like having your own luxurious apartment building in the center of Rome. The rooms are impecable. Not only are they clean, the decor is luxurious. Every amenity has been thought of. The service is unparalleled. There's always someone present when you need them, but never intrusive. The rooftop is the most amazing place to have your breakfast or evening cocktail. I'll never stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hi-tech & Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Lana L
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to stay at this hotel since I read a lot about it and now I can say that it was one of the best places where I stayed. I travel a lot for work reasons, though this time I was just having a holiday with my husband, and I can say that I've never seen a place with people so attentive to our needs and rooms so well decorated. The hotel is part of the Ferragamo group and you soon realise it once you walk in. You can see amazing pictures and references to Salvatore Ferragamo's life on the walls and even in the rooms. We had big expectations after all we read about this hotel and I can say that they completely met them and actually they went even beyond that. The hotel is in a very central position and is small and cozy with an amazing terrace on the top floor where we had breakfast in the morning. The room was very big and we were absolutely surprised to find an ipad in our room that we could use for the whole stay to browse the internet for free, check the email and also read all the information pamphlets about restaurant suggestions, tours, events and services that the concierge loaded in the device. I could even print our boarding passes with a wifi printer right from my iphone and we also found a sort of universal charger for the phone that works for all different devices (samsung, lg, sony, iphone, etc.). Amazing! If we will come to Rome again, this is where we'll stay!!

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfection as possible...”
Reviews.Author: Il_Wass
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a weekend in Rome and stayed at the Portrait suites in the Deluxe Studio. This is a quaint, discreet and personal hotel in a location which is the complete opposite, and it is that combination that instantly gives the Portrait Hotel a huge charm. Our room was beautifully designed, huge space with a separate sitting room and a large bathroom and a beautiful terrace overlooking Via Condotti, the shopping haven of Rome. I'm sure anyone who is reading this review has already gone through some of the reviews for this hotel, and they are all spot on. The service is excellent, the rooms beautiful, everything is extremely clean and the food is great. The asset of this hotel however is the staff. They are attentive, efficient, intelligent and exude charm from the early morning greetings through to the late night farewell. I am struggling to think of a staff that have been this good. Anyway, by all means stay at this place, and book in advance as the small number of rooms might leave you disappointed. We also came in February where the upstairs terrace, which is breathtaking, was not used to its potential. Enjoy. Wassim

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Portrait Suites on the first week of February. It was an incredible experience and it really lived up to our expectations. This amazing boutique hotel is just a few meters away from the Spanish Steps. Rooms are big and stylish. The staff was always smiling, very attentive and helpful. We were also given a complimentary upgrade (thanks Gianluca!). The concierge service is simply what every hotel should aim to. Brekfast was excellent (thanks Alessia!)

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege to enjoy a 4 nights stay at the Portrait Suites in Rome, this is the perfect place to stay: great staff, fantastic concierge (we asked them for restaurants, tours and transfers and the service was, first class), perfect location....very very nice interiors.

Reviews.Title: “Wondefull Place”
Reviews.Author: Sergio S
Reviews.Content: I have been on Portrait Suites, and I strongly recomend this very unique and high level place. I cant call it like a regular Hotel. You feel like at home, very large and great quality and decoration rooms, based on Ferragamo's Life. Very, Very special place, very well located, close of the most atractions, and the best place that I have been in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel and unique staff”
Reviews.Author: pedr0sant0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Portrait Suites for a 5 days visit in Rome (this was not our first visit to the beautiful city of Rome). This boutique hotel is incredible: very intimate, clean and well designed, great location, wonderful terrace and, most of all, great great staff (thanks to the concierge for their help with restaurants and tours!!). The next time we will be in Italy, it will be at the Portrait Suites.

Reviews.Title: “The service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: FO2623
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Portrait Suites in early January. Even before we arrived at the hotel we experienced the excellent and personal service that sets Portrait Suites apart. Because we were travelling with our toddler we requested a particular type of room. As I think is the norm with the staff at the hotel, no request was too much trouble. They ensured that we got the type of room we wanted. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and we were met by Lucca, who offered a truly excellent and personal service (all of the other staff were also excellent and cared about ensuring your stay was as enjoyable as possible). Even though we had not requested an early check in, they knew we would need one, so our room had been prepared and was ready for us to go to for a bit of sleep. Thankfully, checkin was quick and effortless. The hotel itself is in an excellent location and really good for getting around the city. Although it was winter, we were still able to go up to the roof terrace, which is lovely. I would highly recommend staying here. I can't imagine there is a better place to stay in Rome. The hotel is chic and small, with excellent personal service.

Reviews.Title: “A Winning Formula”
Reviews.Author: ABC_1956
Reviews.Content: If you like small hotels of high quality with friendly and helpful service, this is for you. It is ideally located, near the Spanish Steps. That makes it convenient to visit all the major attractions on foot. Taxis are readily available to the door, if you prefer. There is no restaurant, but the staff will make reservations for you and have a helpful list of local (and more distant) restaurants of all descriptions. There is some noise fropm the street, but with the windows closed you can hardly hear it. The rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable. The area is full of designer stores and is kept clean and tidy. There is a wonderful roof terrace with views over much of Rome. It has a well stocked honour bar and breakfast can be ordered there or in the suites. All in all this is among the very best city hotels I have stayed in around the world and it would be impossible to find a better group of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service”
Reviews.Author: HungryHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: When we first arrive at Portrait Suites, we walked halfway down the block before we realized we'd passed it. The tucked away, "hidden" entrance is ideal for exclusivity. Once we did find the hotel, we were greeted by name by the warm and accommodating staff. We got one-on-one personal attention from the very moment we walked in the door and that lasted for our entire stay. The Ferragamo history is intriguing, to say the least. We loved the Ferragamo-inspired decor, from photos to sample shoe pieces. We read Ferragamo's autobiography that was provided in our room and we were truly impressed. We were happy to both take advantage of the discount at the Ferragamo store--as we bought shoes and accessories for the both of us. The rooftop deck was amazing. My wife is a vegan and they happily accommodated her needs during the appertif time each evening. The rooftop deck made the experience so special. The rooms were comfortable and the kitchenette was a great added bonus in the room. We'll definitely be staying here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: S_R301
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in mid-November for 4 days and it was perfect. Excellent location, beautiful room, stunning views across Rome from the terrace and faultless customer service. The staff couldn't have been more attentive and hard-working. Thank you to Francesca, Riccardo and Sarkar for a wonderful stay - if the Ferragamo family are reading this, please reward Francesca with a pair of your lovely shoes and a long holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Hal B
Reviews.Content: We outgrew our B&B phase about twenty years ago, so I was a little worried when I booked us into the 14 room Portrait Suites for my wife's birthday. Fortunately this turned out to the perfect balance of a place that feels like home without the B&B atmosphere of it being someone elses home! With so few rooms the staff is correspondingly small and by the second day you know all of them and they know you. My wife was quite shocked when we stopped by the small reception room one morning to ask about a dinner reservation that evening and she was greeted with "Happy Birthday" (which they'd picked up from her passport). When we returned that evening (from a great restaurant they'd gotten us a reservation at) there was a card and bottle of wine waiting for her, and a short time later one of the staff brought us a bottle of champagne. They also took care of tours and transportation setup so smoothly that it was like having a personal assistant. Your breakfast is either brought to your room or meets you at their rooftop terrace. Breakfast on the terrace is something not to be missed! Overall I'd say this is the first luxury hotel we've stayed in where the service and experience really was worth the extra you pay versus a similar room a typical chain hotel. The rooms themselves are very nice. They are unusually large for a big city, and equipped quite comfortably. I would not change a thing about the Portrait Suites.

Reviews.Title: “The hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: NathalieMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the beginning of november. It was excellent and amazing! The hotel is small and situated on the upper floors of Ferragamo boutique located in a very heart of Rome (the corner of via Condotti and Via Bocca Di Leone). If you want to feel yourself like at home it's gonna be a good choice! The hotel does not look like a hotel in our tradition understating....but like a residential house...the entrance with a little sign plate "Portrait Suit", the door is always closed so you need to call a bell and a staff will immediately take the stairs down and open it. There is no reception hall and the reception desk situated on the 1-st floor looks like a living room....with table, chairs, TV, a console table with beverages for the guests. The room was clean and quiet made in classical minimalism style. The bathroom is also spacious and very clean. There was also a little kitchenette in the room....with all necessary equipment: cooktop, kettle, coffeemaker, microwave, dishwasher etc. But the most excellent place in that hotel is the splendid roof terrace overlooking the Rome...with a fireplace, deck-chairs, tables and a little room where you can choose any beverage you want by your yourself. Portrait Suites offers free Wi-Fi, garage service, bar, continental breakfast served in the studio/suite or outdoor on the rooftop terrace and much more. A special thanks to the excellent staff! They really know how to make you feel at home and if you need anything it is like asking a family member. Just a little example: every our trip to Rome we were trying with my husband to book a table at the restaurant "Dall Bolognese" but we were always unlucky to get there. The same situation was at this time...we tried to book it be in advance but failed to do so. However, Lukka (the guy from reception) sorted this problem out within a second and we finally got a table at this restaurant. Thank you, Lukka! I strongly advise this hotel to everyone! Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: DavidJMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend. It was selected largely due to very favourable reviews on this website. I have been fortunate to travel to Rome several times over the last few years. And overall the hotel is stylish, pleasant and has many great features but it is far from perfect. It certainly stacks up very poorly when compared to the Villa Spalletti Trivelli and probably fits in better when compared to the Villa Laetitia owned by the other shoemaker Fendi. First the suite is poorly designed (isnt Ferragamo all about design?) We were 3 people. The "sitting room" held the second bed. The bathroom was off the bedroom forcing our 3rd person to walk through the bedroom whenever the bathroom was necessary. Not acceptable at this price. The bed was broken and sagged badly. A plastic frame held slats. The plastic was marred and the slats could not be reinstalled. Attempts to fix this had obviously been made many times as the plastic was badly worn. Just poor quality. We realised this as we were leaving and when we mentioned it on leaving this was greeted with a shrug. The bathroom was beautiful and mostly functional. My female travelling mates really liked the Ferragamo products offered. But both of them expressed surprise at the very poor quality toilet paper and tissue. A built in cabinet housing the "kitchen" was very well appointed but it had to be wedged shut at night to turn the lights out. Breakfast is offered by a form which you fill in and and hang on your door at night. The first night we were there the hotel "forgot" to provide this. So no breakfast. Also, we found out when we finally did get this form the second night, anything beyond coffee, juice and a croissant was "extra". The in room safe swallowed our passports and needed the staff to reopen it. A "design problem" we were told. The hotel has a great location. Unfortunately Via Codotti is a very busy street and the room, even with shutters/windows closed and drapes drawn, was very noisy. Others who mentioned that this is their "best hotel experience ever" certainly either had a very different experience than we did or haven't travelled very much. By far the most important though was the fact that the hotel stole money from us. We booked through a well known online agency (Booking.com). Two nights for three people in a suite. This for about 500 Euros/night. When we arrived the desk guy claimed that our reservation was for 2 people. We unfortunately did not have a hard copy of our reservation with us but after he made some phone calls and lots of whining he agreed to give us a "free upgrade" to a 3 person suite. This was a little bit astonishing to us since this is exactly what we had booked. All seemed fine, other than the previously mentioned issues, until we checked out. My wife was presented with a bill that was fully 300 Euros (30%) more than the rate agreed to in writing at booking. The explanation was "breakfast charges" for a breakfast that we were never served also a "tax" of over 100 Euros. Blah blah. Theft! We've booked dozens of hotel rooms online. Prices include tax and in this case breakfast was specifically included in writing. And we have never had a hotel welch on their agreed on price until last weekend. Great hotels do not provide surprises. Stay somewhere else. Or be prepared for a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Perfection”
Reviews.Author: webvrh
Reviews.Content: Owned by the Salvatore Ferragamo family, Portrait Suites is part of the select Lungarno Collection of hotels in Rome and Florence. Located above Ferragamo's men's store along Via Condotti, two blocks from the Spanish Steps, Portrait Suites, like all things Ferragamo, is all about design, style and service with the emphasis on service. The comfortable rooms and public spaces are appointed with vintage Audrey Hepburn photos and Ferragamo shoes and in one instance, a terrific photo of Pope John XXIII throwing snowballs. The bathrooms are all glass, mirrors, and marble with giant bath towels, terry robes and a fantastic shower. The seventh floor terrace, which doubles as a breakfast venue or evening lounge, offers breath taking vistas of Rome. What stands Portrait Suites apart from other pricey hotels, however, is its friendly, personal service. This unique service is neither forced nor insincere. Instead, every employee -- from those working reception (restaurant recommendations, reservations, useful advice, and, if needed, finding an open pharmacy on a Sunday--itself quite an accomplishment -- and delivering much needed over-the-counter medication) to the cleaning staff -- strives to make each guest's visit to Rome special. This was our third stay at Portrait Suites since 2008. See review posted January 10, 2010. Like the previous visits, our stay at Portrait Suites contributed substantially to this four day visit to Rome. Without hesitancy, if I am fortunate to be able to return to Rome, Portrait Suites will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jabah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Portrait Suies for 6 nights in mid to late April this year. It was our first visit to Rome and I have to say this was the best hotel experience we have ever had. The hotel is amazingly stylish and if you don't know anything about Ferragamo you will do after staying here. We picked the hotel based on the recommendations on trip advisor and especially for the roof deck. It did not disappoint. We have great memories of eating breakfast up there every morning and finishing most nights off with a limoncello overlooking Rome. If you are looking for a special place in Rome, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel I have ever stayed at in my life”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute dream come true, everything from the AMAZING staff who are the most wonderful helpful attentive staff I have ever come across, the rooms are divine and super stylish, breakfast in the room was wonderful we were very kindly upgraded to the penthouse suite which had an amazing wrap around balcony with views of the Spanish steps The portrait suites are well worth the price and I could not recommend this hotel more highly Thank you again to all the staff for taking such wonderful care of myself and my mother and father

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Amazing Roof Deck”
Reviews.Author: SarahInSoCal
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, you need to understand that if for no other reason, the Portrait Suites' roof deck makes this hotel amazing. We spent morning, afternoons, evenings on the roof. Basically, whenever we needed a break. I never got tired of enjoying the views from the deck. More on that later. On to the more routine details. We stayed for six nights in September. Unfortunately our flight was delayed and we did not arrive at the hotel until close to 2 am. And yet there were two, not one but two, people waiting to greet us. In fact, they were out on the street looking for our car. It was wonderful to be so well taken care of even at such a late hour. We had booked the most basic room category (we were in 213). It was adequate for our needs but it was not a particularly large room. There is a small but very well equipped kitchenette complete with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, stove, coffee maker, etc., including dishes, silverware, glasses. Realistically, you could actually prepare a meal, though I wasn’t sure how anyone would use the burners given that I found no pots or pans. Having the fridge and the coffee/tea maker was a great perk and we used both throughout our stay. My biggest complaint about the room was the bathroom. We found it to be very small. We also didn’t love the fact that the closet/dressing area was across the room from the bathroom. Given how small the bathroom was we couldn’t keep all of our things in the bath and it was irritating at times to have to trek back and forth. But again, the room was small so it was not a huge issue. I am sure that most hotels in central Rome are not much more (if any more) spacious. As others have noted, this is a boutique hotel so there is no restaurant, spa, etc. If you are looking for a full service hotel, this may not be the place for you. But again, there is the amazing and fabulous roof deck. I really can’t say too much about it. You can see many of the sights from up there and you get to see them at different times of days in different lights. Just watching the comings and goings at the Spanish Steps right down the street is great entertainment. There is an honor bar on the roof deck but to be honest, that label really doesn’t do it justice. It really is an extremely well outfitted bar/kitchen with every type of alcohol and beverage you can imagine as well as an espresso maker, a beer tap and ice machine. You can either help yourself or the staff is happy to make a drink for you. One corner of the deck has a fireplace which is nice in the late evenings. Breakfast is included and though it may not be a full hot breakfast, it does include coffee/tea, juice, milk, cereal, yogurt, bread choices (including decadent nutella filled croissants), etc. If that isn’t enough, you can easily add on eggs, omelets, cheeses, meats, etc. They leave the breakfast menu in your room each day and you just fill it out and leave it on your door before you go to bed. You can even choose to eat in your room or on the amazing deck. The hotel staff was very helpful. Roberto gave us some recommendations as to sights, including the Basilica San Clemente (in honor of our home city here in California!). We enjoyed what he recommended and appreciated his insights. Our only notable issue was one someone previously raised. The hotel arranged an airport pickup for us which was very convenient especially given how late we arrived. However, the fee for that service could not be charged to our room and had to be paid separately to the Concierge service (apparently not the same company) prior to departure. We were not advised of this until 9 pm the night before our departure (and of course I didn’t remember the prior post until then). Luckily we had sufficient cash to pay the amount, but if you are using the Concierge for any paid services, make sure to clarify what will go on your room bill and what won’t. This is a definite area for improvement. All in all, if we return to Rome, we will definitely return to the Portrait Suites. It is a beautiful, modern hotel that is just about as well located as you can get. The rooms an common areas are beautifully decorated. We will book a larger room next time though. Final note: don’t forget the 10% discount at the Ferragamo stores that you get when you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: IrishCal
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the Portrait Suites in Rome. Loved it. Only 14 roooms in the hotel so it is an intimate place a block from the Spainish steps. Decors is modern but classy. The Feragamio family owns this hotel so the walls are covered with pictures of and draws of shoes. The roof top deck is fantastic. Very romantic place to have a glass of wine and look out over Rome. The staff was terrific. Just really enjoyed our stay. My only complaint was that the wifi only worked in a corner of the room and the TV viewing options were limited to local channels - no SkyTV.

Reviews.Title: “A superb boutique hotel with personal attention and service”
Reviews.Author: OrrvilleRedRider
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 year old son and I spent eight nights at the Portrait Suites in late March and early April, 2011. I strongly recommend the hotel. We had two rooms – a Studio Deluxe and a Superior Studio. With our son now nearly six foot tall, we spared him the indignity of a sleeper sofa or cot by getting him his own room. Our room, the Studio Deluxe, was slightly larger than the Superior Studio. The main difference was that we had room for a sofa, two easy chairs, a coffee table and a desk and chair, while our son’s Superior Studio simply had two easy chairs and a coffee table. We also had a walk through dressing area, with more space for our things (our son’s dressing areas and closet was more galley-like). Otherwise, the rooms were essentially the same. The furnishings were modern, yet comfortable. The bedding was very comfortable, and the linens and towels of highest qualify. Both bathrooms had a separate tub and shower – but only one sink. Both rooms also had a kitchenette area (including a dishwasher, small fridge and espresso maker). Lighting was very good in all seating areas and in the reading areas of the bed. The HVAC worked very well (see note below). When the windows were closed, the rooms were extremely quiet. All told, the physical setting and arrangement of the rooms was perfectly lovely. What set the hotel apart, however, were (i) the attentiveness of the staff and (ii) the lovely rooftop terrace. Since this is a very small hotel (only 14 rooms, and we had 2 of them), the staff offers personal attention to all of the guests. Fluent English was on offer, and the staff more than went out of their way to help with dinner reservations, touring assistance and general observations regarding how we could improve our stay in Rome. Moreover, the staff seemed genuinely pleased to see us, and greeted us warmly on each occasion. Bravo. The rooftop terrace – which was more than usable in late March – is glorious, with terrific views of the Spanish Steps and of Rome in general. The seating is most comfortable, and there is plenty of it. Moreover, an honor bar provides the opportunity for refreshment (and free espresso!). Breakfast was good. We had it in our room some of the morning since it was a tad cold for the rooftop. It was better on the rooftop. A few other observations: - this is a very secure hotel, since the only way in is to buzz for admittance, and that is done by the staff in person. - the setting, on the Via Condotti, above the Ferragamo men’s store, is very attractive. There is pedestrian traffic, and some vehicular traffic. Our window looked out on the Brioni store (window shopping only for me). - the hotel is very automated. Generally, that’s great. But one night the system had to be reset, which caused the air conditioning to be turned off accidentally. That led to a somewhat warm room by morning. - the hotel had Roma Passes available for us. That was great – we didn’t have to go looking for them. They also arranged a transfer back to the airport for us. Again, great. What came as a surprise was a note the night before we checked out asking that we pay for both of these in cash, instead of with a credit card. Not a problem in general, but by the night before checkout I had kept only the cash I needed in order to pay tips at the hotel and buy some food at the airport. So, the tip money went to covering the Roma Pass and transfer. - Our room had only one window. That left it a tad dark, especially when factoring in that it was on the third floor. Our son’s room had two windows, and was on the fourth floor – and thus had more natural light. If you like natural light, opt for a higher floor. This is very fine small hotel. I would come back here in an instant. I strongly recommend it to other discerning travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ryanpa_UK
Reviews.Content: Once again I was blown away by a hotel that I selected due to the positive feedback on Trip Advisor!!! The location just couldn’t be any better and the member of staff that welcomed me and checked me in couldn’t have been more welcoming, in fact his customer service throughout my stay was excellent. After a very warm and friendly greeting at the front door we headed up to the stunning roof terrace for a drink while he gave me an overview of the hotel and the highlights of Rome. Then we went to my room and what a beautiful room it was – my room seemed quite large and spacious but also quite cosy. Decoration throughout the hotel is immaculate and my room was no exception – I especially loved the dressing area leading through to the marble bathroom. We opted for breakfast on the terrace which was the perfect way to start the day – the food was to a good standard and well presented but on the second morning (a Sunday) the service was a bit slow as they didn’t seem to have enough staff to deal with the fact that all the rooms wanted to eat at roughly the same time!!! I think we waited 45 minutes for breakfast on the Sunday but that was a minor niggle and didn’t detract from what was an amazing stay overall. Highly recommend staying at the Portrait Suites and next time I’m in Rome this is the only hotel I would be willing stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great people”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hi end hotel in the height of the fashion district in Rome. GREAT roof top garden deck that was sunny and perfect to "get away" from the crowds and have a drink. The room was awesome. The hotel is a small museum to Salvatore Ferragamo the famous designer.. All kinds of interesting wall displays going back 50 years! Very cool. The hotel is not cheap but what is in Rome.. The employees were great! We would go again! Note we have also stayed at the Lungarno Hotel and Hotel suites is Florence Italy and had equally great service and great locations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: phxtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Portrait Suites during our visit to Rome in July. I have never experienced such superb customer service. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that the staff was exceptionally knowledgeable and willing to do whatever was necessary to make our stay perfect. They even gave us very valuable tips that saved us hours in line when visiting the Vatican and the Coliseum. The room was impeccably clean and very comfortable. My favorite part of the hotel is the rooftop patio with comfy couches, a fireplace, a well stocked "honor bar" where you can make your own drinks (unless you would prefer to have them made for you), and an unsurpassed view of the city. When I return to Rome, hopefully soon, I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: OhioRusty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to start our Mediterranean cruise with a three night stay at the Portrait Suites after reading all the rave reviews, and I was not disappointed. Upon arrival we were greeted by Gianluca and he could not have been more accommodating we had just flown in from the U.S.A and were very tired and Gianluca was able to not only check us in early but give us a upgrade so we were very pleased. The room was big and beautifully decorated, it's only fault is that it did not have a balcony. The decor is very subtle the bed is very comfortable and considering the location I was surprised to find the room very quiet. The Hotels location could not have been better you are right in the middle of the most exclusive shopping area and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. My favorite part of the Portrait suites beside the amazing service is the Terrace it is a very special spot that we took advantage of in the morning for breakfast and had Cocktails on the Terrace in the evening . The breakfast was not very interesting but the view made up for it. I would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back on my next visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “A tremendous stay at a small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tribecadoc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for at Portrait Suites this past weekend. What an incredible hotel! Since there are only 14 rooms in the hotel it is very intimate in feel. The rooftop area, where we had breakfast in the morning and drinks from the honor bar in the evening, has a wonderful view of all of Rome. Our room (215) had a small balcony facing Via Condotti, the fashionable shopping street. The room was a very nice suite, with a separate sleeping and living room area (complete with a small kitchen). The bathroom was great in all regards. I would not stay in any other hotel in any future visit to Rome. The is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “location and sofistication”
Reviews.Author: Petre
Reviews.Content: How about have a window looking at Via dei Condotti? And a room with some kitchen stuff to enjoy the things you buy in the Romans markets? The Ferragamo people are improving. And everithing here was perfect. Except, of course, the price. But these is one case that the price is really fair. Dont forget to go to the terrace at the end of the day and take a glass of Processo looking at Roma Skyline

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: drakowski
Reviews.Content: Okay the location is fabulous. Just above the men's Ferragamo store on Via Condotti and Via Bocca de Leone. Did I mention Hermes was directly accross the road? But the hotel is also small ( 14 rooms in total), charming, and beautifully decorated by Michel Bonan. Personally I think it is a much better option than the famous Hotel de Russie. But the hotel does not have a restaurant, gym, spa etc. So if you need those ammenities than this place is not for you. But hey, who are we kidding, who has time to work out when we are busy shopping and sightseeing?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: travel_wm
Reviews.Content: Portrait Suites is a small boutique hotel just at the corner of Via Condotti and Via Bocca de Leone. It is about 100m from the Spanish Steps. It is fabulous. The rooms (we had superior rooms) were awesome (can't imagine what the larger suites must be like). Spacious, stylish, LCD TVs, kitchenette (even w/ small dish washer), walk in type closet, nice bathroom with nice sized shower, and the pillows, sheets and towels were excellent...and free wifi too. While we were concerned about noise at this location, we were pleasantly surprised that it was very quiet. Draw the curtains and the room was dark, quiet – and in mid July, the AC made it nice and cool. Having lived in Rome for a couple of years – we loved the location. We started each morning with a jog through Villa Borghese, which is just up the Spanish Steps. And overall the hotel is centrally located to explore the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Via Condotti shopping area, Via Veneto, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori, etc. All within reasonable walking distances. This is a small boutique hotel --- so it does not have a restaurant or large lobby area. So if you are looking for nice public space in the hotel, this does not have it. But, it does have a fabulous rooftop terrace with nice patio furniture and a few tables and gorgeous panoramic views of Rome --- particularly of the Spanish Steps which are only a short distance away. There is a self-service bar also that is well stocked with almost anything you like. The hotel does offer room service breakfast, which you can also have delivered to the rooftop terrace – which we did each morning. What a great way to start the day having breakfast on the rooftop terrace with fabulous views of Rome. We would often end the evening here with a drink or playing a few games with our kids. The service at the hotel was excellent too. Mariana, Roberto, Fabio, Francesco (I’m sure I left someone out) were all there to take care of our every need. And since the hotel is quite small --- it is almost like you are the only ones there. The staff met our every need – whether making restaurant reservations or museum reservations. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations...even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: vivvitale
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Portrait Suites. It is an oasis in the city of Rome, right near the Spanish Steps and excellent shopping. The roof deck with honor bar is a wonderful place to unwind and relax after a busy day of siteseeing. The staff at the hotel couldn't be any more gracious or accomodating. Though all were wonderful, we want to particularly recognize Francesco and Fabio for making us feel at home and welcome. The hotel is quiet and small, perfect for what we were looking for. We had a range of ages of those in our party - from the 20's to the 70's and all found the hotel very suitable. The rooms are spacious and very well decorated and the hotel is immaculate. The continental breakfast delivered to the room or Terrace was adequate. A suggestion might be to offer a light buffet in the morning on the roof deck. We loved the hotel and recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the middle of chaotic Rome”
Reviews.Author: EmmaF_333
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid May and fell in love with this hotel. This immaculate boutique hotel in the heart of the action of Rome was a haven. The room was very tastefully decorated, with all the mod-cons, wifi, stereo, chargers for every electrical appliance imaginable. But is was the size of the room and the grand bathroom that really impressed. In a city where space is minimal and personal touches often overlooked, this hotel was a highlight. The staff were friendly, and remembered my name everytime I passed by the reception which was on the first floor. There were several different people on duty each day but all would say hello to me by name. They were also very helpful with recommendations and arranging a guide for me during my stay. The breakfast on the roof terrace was a delightful way to start each day. A small bar was also freely available in the evenings on the terrace overlooking the city. The hotel is metres away from the Spanish Steps but there was no noise from the busy street below. The location was perfect and I walked to many of the must do locations around the city. If you are inclinded to shop all the main boutiques are on your doorstep. The Portrait Suites is not a budget hotel. You pay for the privledge of staying here but it was well worth every penny! If you love Rome, you will fall a little bit more in love with the city after you stay at the Portrait Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location and service”
Reviews.Author: TWontour
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Rome for my wife and I in 20 years and we decided to splurge a little - well, more than a little - but we felt it was well worth it. Location first: Just a minute or two from the Spanish Steps and the metro, and smack in the high class shopping area of Rome (which also makes it very safe : police almost always around). If you prefer the occasional do-it-yourself meals (as we do) there is a kitchenette in the room and a supermarket down the street . The cozy rooftop terrace allows you to chill out with a drink in the evenings and take in a splendid view of the eternal city. Lots of touristy looking restaurants (cannot vouch for them) in the vicinity too but the gelato around the corner is excellent. Service,.. ..was the best we have ever received anywhere in the world ! No matter how too trivial or unusual the request, every effort was made to accommodate us. Everyone (and we easily got to know everyone's name - it became that personal) was very concerned that we would have a good week's stay in Rome and indeed we did - grazie mille to all! In summary: Truly a gem of a hotel - and right now our favorite hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular - - Truly One of a Kind”
Reviews.Author: Embargado
Reviews.Content: Portrait Suites is a very small, intimate, boutique hotel owned by the Ferragamo family. Service is top notch, location is excellent and the view fromt he rooftop terrace is spectacular. This would definitely be my choice for a top end hotel when visiting Rome. Breakfast is not a buffet, it is customized to your specific requests and served to you in your room or on the rooftop terrace. Rooftop terrace also has a well stocked honor bar where you mix your own drinks or ring for the bartender to come up and make the drink for you - - an excellent way to make sure you get exactly what you want. This was truly the most unique hotel I have ever stayed at - - I would absolutely go back

Reviews.Title: “Best Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Marnitodd
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful stay at this hip, chic And unique hotel in Rome. From the staff that catered to your every need, to the sexy rooms and suiites to the romantic rooftop oasis there is no better. If location is everything you have found everything. We have found our home away from home in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Fab base for a luxury city break”
Reviews.Author: Rob373
Reviews.Content: I went with massive expectations based on other traveller reviews on trip advisor, and my expectations in the main were met. It took until the last day of our stay for the service to REALLY impress me, when I explained we had a late evening flight as I checked us out, the staff not only made the taxi arrangements as I asked, but also stored our luggage, and invited us to continue to come & go & make use of the roof terrace for the rest of the day. A couple of minor improvements that could be made: 1/ There are no prices for the extensive mini-bar, I would prefer to know what I will be paying. 2/ The "honour bar" I had read about was not explained to us & I therefore did not feel comfortable using it - probably a particularly "English" attitude I know - again, literature in the room would have helped. Roof terrace is brilliant, staff are pleasant, breakfasts are fabulous, rooms are gorgeous, location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Peter_LosFeliz
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough good things about the Portrait Suites. This is as good as it gets. The hotel is small, boutique style, beautiful throughout, clean, perfect location, and an incredible rooftop terrace with firepit and spectacular view of Roma...great for breakfast in the morning. The staff was what we have come to expect from the Lungarno Hotel Group and better than you will find at the other large hotels. I couldnt have asked for more from them, all so helpful and Gianlucca made sure that everything was perfect. I will be honest and that we had originally planned to stay at a famous nearby hotel but at the last minute changed it and I would now never consider another hotel in Rome. You cant go wrong. I also highly recommend their sister hotel in Firenze, the Lungarno Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeybunny1950
Reviews.Content: My husband and I extended our stay in Rome for 2 extra nights after a tour of Italy. I had read the wonderful reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked 2 nights at this hotel. The welcoming staff were exceptional(Simon and Juba sp?)and our room was large and lovely! The beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. We had our breakfasts and spent evenings on the roof-top terrace with spectacular views of Rome and it even had a fireplace that added a special ambiance at night. We couldn't have asked for a better location(Spanish Steps down the street)and shopping and restaurants right next door. Memorable 2 extra nights in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this! Location, Service, Ferragamo Homage”
Reviews.Author: HeHo_70
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a couple that travels the world and they have seen the best hotels. And they were right on...unbelievable hotel. The location is tops (right by Spanish steps in the midst of the designer stores), staff is absolutely attentive and the check-in is personalized and you get to sit in a comfortable armchair and are offered a drink whilst the services are being explained. The rooms have every attention to detail you can image, beautiful and everything gives homage to the history of the Ferragamo's. We loved the colors chosen. You feel right at home and relaxed, not your typical hotel atmosphere at all. We used to stay at the Westin but this is a completely different experience. The spacing was fine so we still had enough privacy with our kids who slept on the pull out couch in the living room. The highlight (yet another one) is the terrace...it's on the top level and you have the most stunning view over Rome. Even though it's shared it has a very private feeling to it. Very pleasant and relaxing! There's an open bar and you can make your own drinks and just write your name and what you took onto a list so that it gets charged to your room later. Very trusting and it gives you the intimacy and freedom you would enjoy on your own terrace. A very pleasant breakfast was also enjoyed on the terrace and it was the perfect start to our day in Rome. We'll be back and will def spread the word about this pearl of a hotel!! A big thank you to the staff for making us and the kids feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: melg16
Reviews.Content: We LOVED portrait suites! The rooms are beautiful (best shower ever!) and the service is amazing. They helped us plan our short 2 days to get everything in that we wanted to do, They even made(and cancelled when we were too tired) dinner reservations for us! Its in a great location with every designer shop nearby, and you even get a discount at the Feragamo store for staying here! LOVED the rooftop terrace!! I cant say enough great things, if you book anywhere else you are just missing out! Thanks to everyone at Portrait Suites for making our Honeymoon so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTM54
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with plenty of storage and light. Nice kitchenette. Thoughtful design (unlike many otherwise lovely hotels) to insure the comfort of guests. Lovely roof top deck. Amazing location. No restaurant but none needed in heart of Rome. Nice breakfast daily. Favorite hotel in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: I come to Rome every April now and while I normally like to try a different hotel every time I am here, I might just become a regular at Portrait Suites.   The experience really started before even being in Rome, they help with everything from booking difficult to get tables to arranging transport.   It does not feel like a hotel, the staff were very helpful (a big thank you to Roberto) everything from the welcome kit to the check in experience, it felt really more like staying at a chic friend's home vs at a hotel, more private and intimate...and of course the location was fantastic ( if not a little dangerously close to all my favorite shoe stores).  I was worried about street noise but could not hear any from the street or other guests. (there were only three other rooms on my floor)  Room 322 came with no view but a walk in closet, kitchenette with everything (incl dish washer).  Room was small but stylish, they still managed to squeeze in a desk, and a small sitting area.  Can't wait to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless”
Reviews.Author: warobbo
Reviews.Content: without a doubt this has been the best hotel that we have ever stayed at. this hotel should be ranked number 1 on tripadvisor...lets start a campaign! where to start...firstly the staff, whoever does the recruitment for the hotel should write a book on the topic because every member of staff delivered the same level of exemplary customer service; they were courteous, chatty, helpful and knowledgeable. they all operated on the basis of intuitive customer needs, for example when you entered through the front door they always called the lift for you so by the time you were in the hotel the lift was ready for you. we celebrated our wedding anniversary whilst we were there, we didnt say anything to the hotel but the chamber maid noticed our cards and that evening we were greeted by a complimentary bottle of wine...nice touch! secondly the hotel; we had a superior room and could not fault anything. designed as you would expect an italian designer hotel to be...but still comfortable and actually made you feel more at home than staying in a hotel. we were dubious about not having a restaurant in the hotel, but it didnt make any difference, breakfast in the room was no trouble and with so many fabulous restaurants close by you want to try them anyway. and finally without doubt THE best location in Rome, every major tourist attraction is within walking distance as were some great restaurants. the view to the spanish steps from the terrace really does take your breath away. this level of accommodation is never going to be cheap, but it does represent great value. if you are planning a special occasion then save up and stay here you will not be disappointed...we are now planning a trip to florence and will definitely be staying at the sister hotel for what we hope will be a repeat in customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Fashion fades, Style remains”
Reviews.Author: Fashionfades
Reviews.Content: I am originally Italian, moved to Usa when I was a kid, based in Sao Paolo now. Hotels have always been my second home, not to say my first one. I never thought places like Portrait Suites could exist. We are not talking about a hotel here the way we are used to think about hotels. Here we talk about a nice and small and cozy place where you can stop worrying about what to do and how to do it. The staff is just brilliant. The hotel manager, Gianluca, is simply perfect. Everytime my wife and I wanted to go somewhere he took the time to ask questions and listen to answer before giving us options. This is exactly the way it has to work. The staff has been trained in doing the same: asking questins, listening to answers and giving options. The Portrait Suites itself is pretty interesting: warm design, great details, perfect. Breathtaking terrace. I have stayed at the other iconic hotels in Rome, you name them. No doubts we will stay here again next time we go to Rome. Grazie Gianluca to you and your team and every one. Bravo, bravissimo!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, best staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: tita12
Reviews.Content: This is really one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, and I do travel quite a bit. It's got an amazing location, right by all the fancy shops and right near the Spanish steps, minutes away from lots of Piazzas and great sites. It's beautiful, the furniture is luxurious and comfortable all at once, of the finest Italian design. But what really made the difference for us was the staff, who were just incredible, tireless, answering every question patiently and in a good mood, helping us with all of our travel needs, and giving us great restaurant and sightseeing tips. We had an unforgettable time at this hotel. Though it's not cheap, it's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Stay at the Portrait Suites”
Reviews.Author: KE_Toronto
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome for my wife's 40th birthday this March. It was our first visit to Rome and I planned the trip as a surprise (and without our 3 kids). We stayed here for 3 nights. We were met at the door to the Portrait Suites by Gianluca who immediately brought us up to the reception/lounge and had our bags whisked away. We were welcomed warmly and offered drinks and a comfortable seat while being checked in. Roberto was introduced and provided an unparalleled introduction to our room and the hotel, including the fantastic terrace! Our room was the deluxe studio which was stylish, roomy, and comfortable. The decor was modern and top-notch. I would rate this above the Four Seasons I've stayed at in North America. The bathroom was outfitted beautifully and we enjoyed the radiant heated floors and rain showerhead. We enjoyed the attention to detail provided by every staff member -- they were always attentive, friendly, and professional. Gianluca provided recommendations on restaurants based on our tastes and reservations were always made for us without delay. We sampled fine seafood at Mare, more typical Roman fare at da Pietro, and had an excellent birthday meal at the trendy and busy Pastificio San Lorenzo! A highlight of the hotel is rooftop terrace. Great views of the Tridente district and Spanish Steps and above the high-end shopping district directly below. There is a well-stocked self-serve "honour" bar which we enjoyed nightly while watching the sunset. The excellent breakfast can also be served on the terrace, something we took advantage of each morning. The hotel is located within a stone's throw to the Spanish Steps and the Spagna metro station. Many restaurants, shops, and historic sites are within walking distance. We ran to and through the Villa Borghese in the morning, walked to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and many Piazzas. Special thanks again to Gianluca and Roberto for their special birthday surprises! This was one of our best trips ever! Will definitely return the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Roma, la città eternamente bella AND Portrait Suites”
Reviews.Author: Logistar
Reviews.Content: Ah bella Roma! It was so hard to leave you ! We added 4 days in Rome after to a trip to see friends further South to kick off our 30th wedding anniversary . Our last trip there was 10 years prior with our then younger sons, and while a wonderful vacation for a family , the thought a more romantic Rome experience ( and accommodation) called to us. Certain we wanted to stay someplace that the accommodation was well located and well designed was important (my husband is an architect) and scale ( a place that offered a more intimate experience) seemed in order. After reading posts on various sites, my first choice was Portrait Suites. The truth is that we were not strangers to the Ferragamo touch as we had visited Il Boro , and sensed that this hotel would likely live up to its high internet marks. After a few emails back and forth to confirm our accommodations, the information began to flow. I had mentioned wanting a special Valentine's Day dinner and soon received a 14 page list of dining suggestions from one of the staff members. Upon arrival we were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff. Luggage was whisked away and we were offered a welcome treat and beverage. Roberto , impeccable and knowledgeable - carefully noted what we hoped to accomplish on this visit. His in-depth knowledge provided us with off beat things to see and do that weren't typical to the guide books. Example-My desire, as a serious cook, was to eat in restaurants where the food would be amazing. As any foodie knows, that does not always mean the most expensive restaurant or those with with a view - so commonly the destination of tourists on vacation. Our dinners were at the tables of the bright and sparkling new chefs who are invigorating the cuisine of Rome with excitement and innovation. Roberto chose restaurants that had style, energy and inventive cuisine. He even planned which one would be best for St. Valentines day- aware that the walk back to Portrait would take us through a stunning park with broad views to the old city , and where lovers (young and old) walked or sat holding hands with the lights of Rome before them. Now this is a concierge who knows his city! The hotel? In a word- impeccable. From entry to interior details, art , finishes and ambiance, its townhouse-like space provides intimacy and charm that larger hotels cannot. At Portrait it was as if you were coming home to your own in- town flat where your 'staff' warmly greeted you anytime of day or night. From the stunning rooftop terrace with fireplace to sexy suite, no detail has been overlooked. Our gorgeous room was restful and generous. From the sumptuous bed to the many thoughtful touches like a nightly bottle of water at your bedside- along with your slippers , a cozy throw ( that I adored), incredible Ferragamo toiletries, massive dressing mirrors and a tiny (but well outfitted) kitchenette. Clearly not one single detail was overlooked in the design of this hotel. Would we recommend Portrait Suites ? Si, si, si ! We plan to return to the wonderful place again knowing we have found friends in the warm and polished staff, and paradise in the modern yet inviting interior along with it's spectacular location. Every morning and evening we enjoyed the roof terrace where the skyline of Roma - her arms wide open to lovers and travelers of all ages for centuries - as our home. This is more than a hotel. It is a place of history, of romance and where dreams do come true. tThe Portrait suites simply sets a bar that other hotels should learn from and should strive to achieve. A 10 on on 10 scale. Grazie mille for providing us with rich memories and an amazing hotel experience in keeping with what was promised.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and luxury thrown in!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomad62
Reviews.Content: Portrait Suites is in the most perfect location in Rome. Via Condotti, the Spanish Steps and every other landmark is within easy walking distance (other than the Vatican). We stayed in a Studio Deluxe room with a view of Via Condotti, the room was large, including a bedroom with King bed, couch, two arm chairs, kitchenette (hidden behind sliding doors) a large dressing room and full bathroom. The only down side of a room facing Via Condotti is you may hear noise into the night of partygoers heading home. The staff were fantastic, knowledgeable, friendly and always smiling. One thing to remember the hotel does not have a restaurant or gym/fitness centre We are looking forward to our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection!”
Reviews.Author: MiMaCyprus
Reviews.Content: Portait Suites is the absolute perfection for a get away in Rome. We visited Rome for 3 nights, mostly for leusure and shopping. Everything about the hotel was perfect and certainly above out expectations. The location, the staff , the room and the service were excellent. Above all, the cost is great value for money if you compare with nearby hotels. We would recommend it without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Quietly perfect”
Reviews.Author: webvrh
Reviews.Content: We were guests at Portrait Suites for the first time in February 2007. We found the experience to greatly exceed our already high expectations. We returned for a second visit in October 2009. We again found Portrait Suites to be the standard against which one measures hotel perfection. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “What EVERY hotel in the world should aspire to”
Reviews.Author: Hossein5
Reviews.Content: The location, decor, room quality, furnishings, sheets, staff, bathroom amenties, attention to detail, personalized service, cleanliness, the list goes on and on. Cannot say enough about this hotel (and I am comparing this across the board to places like the Clardiges in London, the Four Seasons, The Tokyo Ritz Carlton, ....). It is a fancy fancy apartment/home away from home. And to know that they can deliver all this to a large family (we were a group of 9 extended family members with kids) is absolutely amazing. If you want over-the-top attitude and fake glitz, this is not the place for you. If you want real quality, style, and service, this is IT!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in, anywhere in the world!”
Reviews.Author: lilfoodiegirl
Reviews.Content: I've traveled all over the world, for business and for pleasure, but this hotel takes the cake for service and luxury. The location was perfect, just an elegant, unmarked doorway next to the Ferragamo store on the Via Condotti. When you ring the bell, one of the wonderful staffers runs down to greet you, asking how your day was, wishing you a wonderful evening. The staff got us dinner reservations every night of our first 4 nights there. We went to Venice for 3 days, then returned for one last night to the Portrait Suites so we could catch our early morning plane. They upgraded us to the Penthouse suite! The service was outstanding, our personal concierge 24 hours a day. The bed was firm but cozy, the pillows just the right cushiness. All the linens were beautiful. The in-room breakfast was delicious. The amenities were from Salvatore Ferragamo, they were all great and smelled fantastico. Instead of chocolate, I preferred the nightly bottle of water, and they provided us with lip balm next to the bed. How did they know that's the last thing I put on before I go to sleep? I felt pampered in this small, cozy, luxurious hotel, such a wonderful respite from a hot sweaty day of sightseeing. I was sad to leave, not only the beautiful room, but my new "friends," the charming staff. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfphotonyc
Reviews.Content: Had a great week at The Portrait Suites. The room was completely soundproof even though it's right in the middle of one of Rome's busiest shopping streets. After a day of walking it was a great place to rest before going out in the evening and the rooftop honor bar was exquisite. The staff were charming and helpful and the room was perfectly appointed. LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Brit2989
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of our honeymoon and were welcomed to our room with a chilled bottle of prosecco and a fruit plate. The room itself was amazing and had its own terrace overlooking Via Condotti and the Spanish steps. After a day of exploring Rome we would look forward to spending some time chilling out on the roof terrace with a glass of wine watching the sun set. We got some amazing recommendations for restaurants from the hotel - Mirabelle was a particular favourite overlooking Rome! The room itself was very spacious and immaculately decorated. The bathroom was large and had a great rain shower. The breakfasts were great and made to order! We loved every second of staying here and it was certainly a welcome haven in between wandering around Rome. We loved Rome and walked everywhere from the hotel because it is very well located. Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cicerone2810
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in September 2010. Our expectations of every aspect of the hotel were surpassed. We were very warmly welcomed upon arrival and each and every time we returned to the hotel after exploring Rome’s many attractions. The staff went out of their way to spend time discussing the local area, recommending restaurants and booking private tours. I did not believe that there could be a hotel that could be the perfect city hotel but this is it. There is nothing else you could possibly require from a hotel that the Portrait Suites does not offer. The design of the rooms makes the most of the space available; the Ferragamo fabrics add a unique and luxurious feel to the rooms. The rest of the hotel is beautiful; it usually took us a while to reach our room as we were so distracted by the beautiful sketches and photographs leading up the walls on the stairway. The rooftop terrace was one of my main reasons for booking Portrait Suites, and I was not disappointed. The honesty bar was well stocked and the breathtaking view of the sun setting over the terracotta rooftops of Rome, in such privacy, is unrivalled. Overall, we did not want to leave and I can say truly say that there is nowhere else I would even consider staying on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: MASToronto
Reviews.Content: If your budget allows, stay at this small boutique hotel! My husband and I recently stayed in the Portrait Suites at the end of a 2-week Italian trip, and we definetly saved the best for last! We are a couple in our mid-40's who travel a fair bit, and have stayed in a range of hotels. From the moment of our arrival, the service exceeded expectations - every last detail is looked after or are easily arranged, such as tours. We had a deluxe studio which was spacious, airy, with extremely large and well appointed bathroom, closet, and minibar. Also, the location near Spanish Steps is very convenient. The best feature though has to be the roof top terrace, which has incredible views and is a great spot to relax with a glass of wine or two and take in the city. I'm actually looking for ways to return to Rome, just to stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: KCKCJY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Portrait Suites in early August. It lacks some features of large hotels such as gym, pool and restaurant but in every other aspect it was the best hotel we have stayed at in a number of European cities. Great service, exceptionally large rooms, tasteful furnishing, excellent breakfast (included in the room rate) and superb location. The only slight complaint was the water pressure from the shower, probably because we were up on the 6th (top floor) of the hotel. I particularly appreciate the honor bar at the roof top where you take what you like and record what you take. Your honor is your only check. Great system !

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Luke182
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Sure, Portrait Suites is unassuming and small -- you barely even know it's there! -- and the front door is locked, making you think you're in the wrong place. But once one of the fantastic, well-dressed staffers races down from the second floor main office, huffing and puffing, and smiling, you get the idea that yes, this is the place. The rooms are cutting edge modern and ultra cool, and the location is probably the best in Rome, just a couple of blocks from the Spanish Steps, and right in the heart of the fancy shopping district. Everything about this place is great. There is an amazing rooftop terrace for unwinding, and having complimentary breakfast served, and even grabbing a beer from the honor bar at night. They'll loan you a laptop computer for wireless web access, and they'll also just leave stuff for you in the room, like fruit, and bath and fragrance things. You'll fall in love with the staff and not want to leave. As we finished our 2 week honeymoon, my wife and I agreed that Fabio at the Portrait Suites was the best person we came across in all of Italy. But they're all fantastic at the Portrait Suites. The price is pretty reasonable, too. For us, it's a no-brainer when we go back to Rome. We'll stay at the Portrait Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sinbarambam
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and rooms, and oh that rooftop....Service was excellent too. At half the price of most 5 star hotels in Rome, this is a great bet as long as you don't expect a hotel (there is no lobby, pool or restaurant for example).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaElen
Reviews.Content: Portrait Suites is one of the best hotels we've ever been, all the features offered were excellent, the service , design, cleanliness, location near Via Condoti, Piazza Spagna area. A great hotel of Salvatore Ferragamo in which you feel like living in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AandASanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night at the start of our visit to Rome. The hotel is superbly positioned about 2 blocks from the bottom of the Spanish steps but just slightly off the main street so that it is relatively quiet. This is certainly one of the smaller boutique hotels we have stayed at and the reception area is a very small room on the fist floor reached by a lift or short flight of stairs. Other than that there are no public areas at all except the lovely terrace on the top floor which also serves breakfast (which we didn't experience) Our room was a beautiful suite on the 4th floor extremely tastefully decorated (as you would expect from Salvatore Ferragamo) and very comfortable indeed. No views to mention from either of our two sets of windows but this shouldn't be surprising in a city centre. Staff were exceptionally helpful with restaurant recommendations - in fact, they have a wonderful little guide to a wide variety of restaurants in Rome which you must use and which is broken down into, chic, modern, traditional trattoria etc. My only very mildly negative comment concerns parking. It is a fairly difficult hotel to drive to (being in the controlled zone) and there is no parking. Similarly there is no parking service although one of the excellent staff accompanied me in the car to a garage approximately half a mile away and walked back with me to the hotel. The following day we had to negotiate our way back to the hotel to collect our luggage. No big deal but you should think twice before taking a car there. All in all a very enjoyable stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, fabulous & memorable hotel in superb location. Go!”
Reviews.Author: CITY_BREAK_KAT
Reviews.Content: I've only just got round to writing this review but really felt I must - staying here was such a wonderful experience. Everything was perfect - the staff, the location, the decor, the attention to detail. When we arrived (late and in the rain), we were greeted with such a warm welcome. Roman Holiday was playing on the TV in the reception area, truly setting the scene, and the staff offered welcome drinks and a seat in very slouchy chairs! We immediately felt at home and the staff chatted to us and took time to talk us through the hotel, the local area and the tourist attractions. As a girl and general lover of shoes, I was already impressed with the Ferragamo shoe displays and Audrey Hepburn photos carefully displayed in the hall and up the stairway on the way to reception. Ferragamo is a renowned designer and the decor and quality in the rooms and throughout the hotel lived up to his reputation. His shop is located downstairs on one of the main designer shopping streets, and just minutes away from the Spanish Steps. It's an excellent location, and surprisingly quiet as the hotel have managed to get the entrance on a much quieter street. Breakfast was served on silver service trays each morning in the room (it's served on the terrace when the weather is nice) and was lovely. Bathrobes, slippers and the bed were cosy, comfy and luxurious. Our room had a large dressing area and also a very cleverly designed kitchen area with superb coffee maker and jars of lovely goodies - a very welcome alternative to the usual mini bar fayre. The autobiography of Ferragamo left in the room is well worth a read, and of course Roman Holiday and other must see films are available to watch in your room! The staff really did make this holiday though - we don't encounter such helpful, cheery and welcoming types quite as often as we should in hotels of this level. An excellent hotel - book it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, staff and rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: aussie_meee
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place to stay - and about 200 metres from the Spanish Steps. From the moment you walk in the door the staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble. They recommended great restaurants and got us tickets to a sold-out exhibition. They also let us borrow a laptop for our stay as ours died. The rooms are beautiful with a kitchen and walk-in wardrobe, large bathroom and comfortable bed. The highlight of the hotel is the rooftop terrace. Overlooking the Spanish Steps with very comfortable furniture and an outdoor fireplace you never want to leave. The honour bar means you can choose your own drinks without having to go anywhere. The only thing which wasnt fantastic was the breakfast. But as it was included in the rate it didnt really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in the heart of luxury boutiques”
Reviews.Author: ceynoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in Portrait Suites in February 2010 for a romantic long-weekend. The hotel which belongs to the Ferragamo family, has an unbeatable advantage to others in terms of location. It is just steps away from the Spanish Steps and your next door neighbors are Versace, Hermes etc.. It has around 15 rooms, and a small room that counts as a reception on the first floor. Basically you have to ring the bell and the receptionist comes to open the door for you. There is no restaurant but you can order limited room service if you feel craving at night. The breakfast is served in your room in the morning, which is limited but tasty, and feels good if you like to eat your breakfast in bed. We stayed in a junior suite which was very tastefully decorated with two flat screen tvs and a kitchenette in the living room area. There is not bathtub in the bathroom but a shower, so if you must have a bubble bath after walking all around Rome to relax, you must be careful. In the room there is dvd and ipod player, and you can take out dvds from the hotels reception. The hotel staff is very helpful and knowledgeable, and they recommend great restaurants that are known mostly to Italians.
