We quite liked the fact that this is a very small boutique hotel and you dont have to meet a million people when you are in and out of the hotel but you can come in and out as if it is your house. However, it was winter when we were there but in summer one may require more space or gardens to chill out. There is a lovely roof terrace where they could also serve food, but it was rainy during our stay so we could not use it. I would recommend this hotel for a long weekend for couples, without kids as there is not even a corridor for kids to run around but stairs..

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome period.”
Reviews.Author: BAJZK
Reviews.Content: If you're hesitating between portrait suites and another hotel- quit wasting your time and book portrait now! You won't regret it. Awesome suites that make you feel at home, service that takes care of your every need, and a location to die for- this hotel has it all. Booked it for a romantic weekend with the missus and let's just say I knocked this one out of the park. Just be careful they only have 14 rooms so they sell out quick. Book it now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sipping cocktails on the roof terrace looking at the Spanish steps with the one you love!”
Reviews.Author: RDTYORKSHIRE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a short break to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday and we could not have asked for a more relaxing and enjoyable stay. The location is superb in the heart of the shopping district and our first afternoon was spent relaxing in the heat on the roof terrace sipping perfectly mixed cosmopolitans looking across the rooftops at the Spanish steps. We took all of our breakfasts on the roof terrace as well and it felt as if we had the place to ourselves. Our room was well proportioned and extremely comfortable and the staff were excellent recommending some hidden gems of restaurants (bear in mind it does not have one itself). Whether I would recommend this hotel for a long stay I am not sure but for a short break in an amazing location with a perfect roof terrace to sip champagne and relax after a days shopping I certainly would. If you do go try to coincide your stay with an event at the Terme di Caracalla - what an amazing venue!

Reviews.Title: “secret gem in heart of shopping district”
Reviews.Author: lownielass
Reviews.Content: This is a private little gem in the heart of the shopping district at the bottom of the Spanish Steps. The hotel is a collection of 14 rooms located above the Feragamo store. The suites are finely appointed with tables resembling suitcases and photos of shoes throughout. The suites have remarkable built in kitchenettes including small dishwashers and cooktops so you could cook your own dinner en suite. The bathroom is a little small, with little space for a wash kit, but an amazing collection of shampoos and lotions are provided. Turn down service is complete with a bottle of water and slippers laid out for you. Continental breakfast is included and is lovely with an assortment of rolls (including chocolate croissants!) and breads, warm milk and cappacino and delicious musseli. All staff were polite and incredibly helpful. Ask and they will accomodate. There is a lovely rooftop lounge with fireplace and honor bar and fantastic views of Rome. The only thing this hotel lacks is a central lobby, though the rooftop helps make up for this. We hope to to visit here again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Engred
Reviews.Content: After 7 days in Florence and Tuscany, we ended our Italian vacation with three days at the Portrait Suites in Rome. Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location with a fabulous rooftop deck for breakfast, cocktails or just hanging out. This was our first trip to Italy and my in-laws hired a private guide to assist us with the trip. Guido Gambone was the BEST GUIDE EVER, pre-arranging all of our activities and meals so the entire trip went smoothly. Literally, there was not one thing that did not happen perfectly, including driving the entire trip, thanks to Guido. I would highly recommend him - he is worth every penny, as is the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique in Upscale Area”
Reviews.Author: HessMug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an upscale, walking-only shopping district of Rome, near such stores as Ferragamo and Gucci. (Sadly, no Spencer Gifts) The room was small, but very nice. Flat paneled TV, free wifi, nice bedding, comfortable beds, new bathrooms. No views to be had out of my window. After my first night there, the cleaning room apparently used some sort of toxic, nostril-burning cleaner on one of my countertops, which prompted them to move me to a suite at no extra charge. Not a huge hassle and they looked as if they were about to tell me they found a dead body in my room when they approached me with the news upon my return to the hotel. As advertised, the 7th floor rooftop garden is one of the nicest features of the hotel. Guests receive complimentary access until midnight. It gives splendid nighttime views of the area and the Spanish Steps. They stock a pantry on the roof each night with plenty of drinks, mixers, snacks, lemons, ice, etc for guests to serve themselves in exchange for IOU slips. Very cool, utilized and unusually trusting. Concierge service was extremely helpful and efficient -- offering to hook up a private tour of the Vatican for an hourly fee. Breakfast is included -- though they charge for anything cooked or heated -- like eggs. Some quirks about the hotel: --The front door is always locked and you must ring a bell and flash a room key to a camera to gain entrance --The "lobby" is on the 2nd floor. Upon arrival, you are brought into the room, sat down and presented a package about the hotel and services offered. --You must insert your room key into a slot to activate electricity in your room. I couldn't tell whether I liked this or not. It seemed really futuristic and advanced at times, and like a useless Epcot Center-like erroneous prediction about the future at others. --Some taxis drive in the walking only section to the front door of the hotel, while others drop you off at the Spanish steps -- 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, if not the best!”
Reviews.Author: sophiecaroline
Reviews.Content: I would not for one minute hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel and service is the best I have ever had, and let me tell you, my husband and I travel a lot and have stayed in some pretty remarkable hotels! It is absolutely breath taking, they have an amazing roof top bar, the rooms are just outstanding, they do not miss a thing! The style is mind blowing! Everyone must stay here, and I believe they have more hotels around Italy. I cannot say enough about this place or for the service. DO NOT STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!! I give it a 20 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rome”
Reviews.Author: maven2929
Reviews.Content: PORTRAIT SUITES Arrived at the Rome Termini train station determined not to be ripped off by a cab driver, like we usually are. This time the driver not only sped up the meter, he dropped us off at the corner of a one way street and explained that if he took us all the way to PORTRAIT SUITES he would have to drive a much greater distance. He said that the hotel was merely 30 meters down the street. So we paid him the 30 EUROS on the meter and rolled out luggage down the cobble stoned street. The hotel was FIVE blocks away. I will never take a taxi at the Rome Termini again. Arrived at PORTRAIT SUITES sweaty, tired and pissed off. Things changed rapidly when we were greeted by the staff. It was truly like arriving at a friends home for a visit. The hotel looks more like a private residence than a business. And the staff, especially the vivacious and beautiful Giordana, was lovely and very welcoming. The room was, as requested, not on the street side and thus completely quiet with no street noise. The king bed was very comfortable with plush linens and bedding. The marble bathroom was adequate and the shower was huge. The floor of the shower was strangely slippery when dry and stable when wet. The room had a large desk. The electric outlets at the desk were difficult to reach. There was a kitchenette with microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator and utensils. The closet was large with much drawer space. The hotel location was superb, better than the Russie where we usually stay. We were very happy with Portrait Suites and will return. My one complaint is the breakfast which, though very adequate by Italian standards was not sufficient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HoustonLuxuryAgent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four fabulous nights at the Portrait Suites in Rome over Valentine's Day weekend. The staff, location, service and rooms were superb. Location, location, location : Portrait Suites is hands down the best location in Rome. It sits above the men's Ferragamo Store and is located right next to Versace and across the street from Hermes on the Via Condotti, so bring your credit card ! But, the most spectacular locale near the hotel is the world-famous Spanish Steps, which you can view while enjoying a glass of wine atop the hotel's wonderful rooftop terrace. Although the weather was chilly we spent many evenings on the rooftop terrace, enjoying a glass of wine by the fireplace while trying to decide where to go for dinner . With all the amazing choices, making dinner plans in Rome can be difficult, but the hotel's capable staff was always ready with a recommendation and an offer to make reservations on our behalf. The hotel is small - it has only 14 rooms - but the atmosphere is cozy and inviting. The rooms are spacious and include all the requisite amenities for a comfortable home away from home; features include a mini-kitchen equipped with a microwave, cooktop, and coffee/espresso machine, a spacious refrigerator, flat-screen TV, and the most comfortable beds we have ever enjoyed in Europe. There is also plenty of closet and storage space to accommodate all the purchases you are bound to make when you succumb to temptation in the many upscale stores located within a stone's throw of the hotel. Alas, the sumptuous continental breakfast served every morning just about eliminates the need to fire up any kitchen appliances. Check-in, if you can call it that, is seamless and feels more like a very personal and inviting welcome into your own private apartment in Rome. Portrait Suites is a wonderful property and a must for anyone considering a Valentine's Day stay in Rome. There is no better place to be with the person you love than in Rome, especially if you want to pick up that extra something special in the most fabulous shopping area in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: inked_chef
Reviews.Content: After going through all the options for my accommodations in Rome i finally settled with portrait suites. Here are the reasons why to stay in portrait suites. 1. Location - Since we were only spending a few nights in Rome it was the location of the hotel that sealed the deal. Its right smack on Via Condoti and walking distance to almost all the sites. 2. Service - This is what makes the hotel very very special. Service was very genuine and effortless. 3. Design- Contemporary yet it did not feel cold, maybe it was because of the service. The room was spacious , the roof top was excellent and the honesty bar was the best way to relax and take in the view of the spanish steps after walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “best of the lugarno hotels and best in rome”
Reviews.Author: rubyyao
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend stumbled upon the portrait suites while we were shopping on via condotti and we went in to check it out and was immediately blown away. (we were staying at la posta vecchia in lazio which is another great hotel but that's another story) anyway, we decided to move there and had a truly great experience. the staff are all so friendly and helpful and the roof top garden is exceptional. the property is superbly furnished and really feels like home away from home. the location is superb needless to say...the best among the lugarno hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Portrait Suites, best hotel in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: birddogilainen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great contemporary hotel in Rome, with personalized service, then look no further! Travelled to Rome in September for a long weekend. As always, tried to find an excellent hotel that is contemporary, central location and overall just great, without any flashy paintings, wanna be gold detailing or chandelliers. Being a picky traveller that has been quite a few places, looked at many many hotels in Rome, found it hard to find a good hotel that met my standards, drawing comparisons to other design/boutique hotels in other large cities. Then stumbled on to Portrait Suites and although somewhat expensive (all hotels in Rome seem expensive...), did not regret this choice for one second. The room had a very good size, we had our own balcony (next to the Penthouse suite, only a limited amount of rooms seem to have one). Bathroom was nice, contemporary design, nothing too flashy, just the way it should be, separate shower/bath tub. Location is fantastic, a small side street to Via Condotti, we had a view over the Spanish Steps from the room (200 meters away), with walking distance to lots of good restaurants. What really sets this hotel apart is two things: 1) Personal service. I have never experienced such personal service, the staff took a personal interest in you and could spend hours finding the right restaurant (at last, we made up our mind ;-)). I have stayed at various 4/5 star properties and albeit service in general is good and can be overwhelming in some places, I really felt that this service was more personal and not just service as a concept. 2) This has to do with #1, but since the hotel is small with a limited amount of rooms, it feels very very cozy and again, that personal detail to everything. I would not hesitate coming back and will also recommend this to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Italiance elegance at its best”
Reviews.Author: SWT22
Reviews.Content: If you like hotels that have the feel of a private residence, this is the place for you in Rome. The Portrait Suites consist of 15 rooms (three per floor). Their entrance that does not draw attention, and there is no reception desk. After having been greeted at the door, you will be welcomed in a private lounge on the first floor. One literally feels at home there. The small size of this hotel also means that there is no restaurant. In my view, this is okay, since there are so many great places to eat all around. There are also no pool and no spa, but some rooms are equipped with a private sauna and a mini-gym (which in my view is much better). The location is great (especially if you like shopping: Ferragamo, Gucci, Prada, and all the others are within immediate reach) and very central (two minutes from the Spanish Steps), and there is a fantastic rooftop terrace with a unique view over all Rome. Only one negative point should be noted: soundproofing of the rooms could be significantly better.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further, this is THE Place to Stay When in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: RMCONNERS
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel!!! We loved the location, it's literally a few steps from the Spanish Steps. The rooms are spotless, beds are extremely comfortable and completely soundproofed. The staff is equal to that in a five star hotel. We're stopping in Rome for a few nights at the end of a trip we're taking this June and I'm so sad this property is already booked. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! If you're looking for a luxury boutique hotel that's spotlessly clean with exemplary service, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “great rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollymnyc
Reviews.Content: Portrait Suites is really a great property. The service is top notch - all of the staff are incredibly welcoming and helpful, and they really make you feel at home. The room (number 53) was thoughtfully laid out and nicely decorated, with lots of storage space and a little kitchenette and table, large bathroom with a deep tub and really nice shower. TV (large flat screen) is nice, and although channels are limited, the DVD player in the room helped - just bought a bunch of Italian films with English subtitles to watch in the room. The room also had a nice balcony overlooking Via Condotti. The rooftop terrace (with cozy fireplace!) is spectacular, with views of the Spanish Steps and much of Rome. The one drawback at Portrait Suites is that save for the continental breakfast (which is just okay), there is no room service. Generally not a problem in Rome where great food is ample, but occasionally missed. Even thought it is a small hotel, it would be great if they could make an arrangement with another nearby hotel or a restaurant to deliver to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, attentive, and brillant location!”
Reviews.Author: blndzhvmrfn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the real pleasure of staying at the Portrait Suites for five days this past month and I really cannot say enough about the property. From the minute you check in the staff makes you feel like you are the only guests. The rooms are perfectly appointed - from the mohair sofa to the Ferragamo fabric lining the drapery. Vintage shoes in cases and lithographs of shoe designs(Ferragamo of course)decorate the walls. We had a deluxe studio with a kitchenette, a big walk thru closet and huge bath. My in-laws were traveling with us and their room was the superior studio and it was just as lovely but not as big. But the service was the best part of the stay. When they say anything you need, they mean it and it is a phone call away. The roof top terrace was amazing with a full honor bar and a cozy fireplace for cocktails after a long day of touring. They give you the option of paying 20E a day for unlimited use of the honor bar but we chose not to take it. And then there is the location. It is about 20 ft off the Via Condotti and easy walking distance to a ton of great restaurants. It was a little expensive but worth every penny and will be my first choice the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a great location”
Reviews.Author: BallyT
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Rome and the Portrait Suites. The best thing about it, is the location off the Via Condotti and the staff are very helpful. We had paid for a deluxe studio and it was very expensive and I had asked for a view in my booking as I knew one of their 3 rooms at this price had a good view . What we had, was a room at the back overlooking next door's kitchen and roof garden. This was very disappointing. The room was also rather dark. There is no doubt that everything is very clean and very well serviced. Unfortunatly the weather was wet while we were there so we could take very limited advantage of the outdoor terrace. I imagine in summer it is wonderful. Having said that, would I go back there again, probably not in Winter. I also thought the breakfast was very limited and I certainly do not want to cook on my holidays, all in all I would have to say it was a mixed experience.

Reviews.Title: “Private Haven in the Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: mmbuhrig
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to stay at the fantastic Portrait Suites for three nights in September. The excellent service began before we arrived when the hotel arranged a private car pick-up from the airport (the highly knowledgeable driver even gave us a detailed tour of Rome during the drive). Upon arrival staff was waiting to greet us at the door, a nondescript entrance just off Via Condotti. The highly personalized reception took place in a well appointed room where we were offered refreshments, told about the hotel and our complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suit, and advised of the expected weather during our stay. This was followed by an escort to our room. I can’t speak to the other rooms as I wasn’t able to see inside any of them, but the Junior Suite was perfectly appointed and of decent size (extremely spacious for Europe): the sitting room had a sofa, coffee table and chairs, a plasma TV and a hide-away, stocked kitchenette complete with two-burner range, dishwasher, refrigerator and espresso machine. This was separated by a sliding door from the bedroom with desk, closet, plasma TV and an extremely firm (though comfortable) bed. The bathroom had all the essentials including great water pressure in the large shower. The included continental breakfast was a bit sparse in selection, though the few pastries I tried were quite good and the cappuccino always arrived fresh. They even managed to secure last minute reservations for a restaurant which I’d heard about before arriving (called rHome), a feat even AmEx Platinum Concierge couldn’t pull off (as an aside, rHome was undoubtedly the worst restaurant I’d ever been to in my life, but as the suggestion was mine and not the hotel’s, I can’t fault them). There is no room service or gym but during our short stay we didn’t need either. The best feature of the hotel is undoubtedly the rooftop bar, with its fireplace, comfortable seating and honor bar (well stocked with everything you’ll need for a relaxing evening looking out over Rome). Overall, the location is superb (above Ferragamo just off the Via Condotti), the hotel is quiet and intimate (with 14 rooms, expect more private villa than grand dame hotel) and the design of the hotel is contemporary while maintaining warmth. You don’t need to love Ferragamo (though who doesn’t!) to love the Portrait Suites but if you do, you’ll enjoy it even more, as the walls are lined with photographs and drawings by Salvatore himself (mostly copies but interesting to look at nonetheless). The hotel is pricy, but with its impeccable service, central location and quality appointments, it’s worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mohsen000
Reviews.Content: The location is one of the best in Rome. At the bottom of the Spanish Steps. If you are looking for a hotel with a grand lobby and restaurant this is not the place for you. If your looking a luxury quite peaceful hotel with large modern rooms & bathrooms this is the place. Service was excellent. The roof top terrace is just lovely, view of Spanish steps and the whole of Rome. Staff was very helpful and very friendly. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone. WiFi had too much security on it hard to get a VPN connection and the room a little cool. Lots of nice place's to eat around the hotel. The private taxi to the airport was a smoker so if you dont smoking please tell the hotel you want a non smoker as a driver

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely outstanding. Location is fantastic. Rooms are very beautifully fitted (along with very witty and romantic Roman fashion photo art), the roof terrace is very relaxing (with great self-service bar) and the staff are excellent. From the moment you arrive, they deal with everything in an professional, friending and engaging way. My experience is that traditional Italian high-end hotels consistently disappoint in service and room quality. Portrait Suites is not traditional (and not exactly a hotel given the lack of anything but rooms and a terrace) and for €500 per night (good for top-end Rome) it is an excellent urban place to stay. Our room was a studio and therefore also not really a suite but it was perfectly spacious for a couple. Bathroom was huge. Other good touch is that for €20 per person per day, you can have free run of the terrace bar and mini-bar (prosecco and snacks on tap). Probably a good deal for the hotel unless you are alcoholic but it is a good system for guests too. One more note about the service. It was stress tested whilst we were there because the City of Rome decided to dig up and relay the via Condotti between 11pm and 7am without warning. Despite the soundproofing, the noise was appaling. The staff did everything they could to solve the problem (looking for alternative hotels), apologise, sympathise with a terrible problem the hotel hadn't caused and couldn't solve. I would trust these guys to handle anything.

Reviews.Title: “portrait suites was the highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: mangiaMichigan
Reviews.Content: The portrait suites is part of the lungarno chain which is owned by the ferragamo family.. location via condotti the rooms were amazing but the attitude of the management and the staff was so welcoming and charming it made the cost worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Globbo
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, with a discreet entrance just off the via Condotti near the Spanish Steps. My Studio Room was very comfortable, with a king bed, walk-in closet, flat screen TV and a good-sized marble bathroom. I loved the roof terrace - what a great view! It's a perfect place for their continental breakfast. This hotel isn't for everyone though - there are no indoor public spaces to speak of, making this hotel perhaps not a good choice in winter. There is also no room service (except if you wish to take your continental breakfast in your room). If you don't need a fitness center and you plan on eating out all your meals except breakfast, this is a great pick. Also, check out the nearby restaurant Palatium, focused on wines and foods of the Lazio region around Rome - very tasty, and a mostly young Italian clientele (at least the night I visited).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: minniemouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Portrait Suites last week. We were very happy with the room. It's beautifully decorated, very quiet and comfortable. We were surprised to find that our suite included a tiny kitchen, complete with dishes and silverware, a two burner stove and microwave, dishwaasher and an espresso maker. We didn't do any cooking, but the espresso maker was very nice and the refrigerator/minibar was roomy. The bathroom was great with a giant showerhead, great towels, and very nice bathroom amenities. The closet was roomy enough for lots of clothes, there was a table for breakfast and a desk and a big flat panel hd tv. The only problem I encountered involved my pillow request. I had emailed ahead and asked them if they could provide a down pillow and they said they would. I reconfirmed but when we got there, there was no down pillow. I mentioned it to the manager and she said that all the pillows were down inside, which made no sense because I looked at the labels which read cotton/polyester. She graciously offered to buy me a down pillow. I really appreciated the effort, but it turned out that she purchased another cotton or poly pillow. I don't like to complain, so I didn't say anything again, but suffered a couple of migraines as a result. We ran into the manager on the last day and she asked about it and we discussed it. In spite of this, I think that the service and accommodations were excellent and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's new reference: Portrait Suites and then when ur hungry: Ziro!!”
Reviews.Author: Nucc
Reviews.Content: WOW!.... What else to say when you grab your breakfast under the sun on a terrass just in front of the Spanish steps!. Only 14 rooms amazingly decorated (Ferragamo) but above all it gives you really the impression to be in your own private house in the middle of the best distrcit. DEFINITELY add another spectacular part to your stay and go grab a bite at Ziro (only 5 mins away!). I had read loads of positive critiques in papers and clearly it was a great bet, fact is I even cancelled my reservation in a famous trattoria 2nd night to go back to Ziro, simply impressive!

Reviews.Title: “such a Paradise”
Reviews.Author: serandreica'pisani
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay 1 night (only, unfortunately!) at this wonderful, small hotel in the heart of Rome, and I am just looking forward to go back. It consists of only 14 rooms and the atmosphere is extremely warm and chic at the same time. incredibly kind staff, attention to details, breathtaking view from the terrace where, in warm weather, you can enjoy your breakfast. I am so glad to have found the 'Portrait Suites'!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: deebee
Reviews.Content: Charming staff at check-in, beautiful modern clean rooms, fantastic location next to Versace and just steps from every designer shop possible. Had a fantastic meal at Target (recommended by concierge) on our first night. Our next meal at Rhome not so good, very pleasant waiter but unbelievably slow service and food nowhere near the standard of the Target restaurant and the night we ate there Rhome restaurant was showing the rematch between manchester united and Roma on two huge flat screens (we couldn't have picked a worse night!!) i think the kitchen staff were all watching the match and were in no hurry to serve a table of Brits!! Anyway the hotel was a great find, the rooftop terrace was beautiful but the drinks service up there was incredibly slow. We ordered a bottle of Frascati and it took over half an hour to arrive it didnt really matter because we were with another couple so we all sat chatting in the sunshine and when it arrived it was beautifully served on a lovely tray with crisps and nuts but it was a long wait and something that needs improvement ,a simple drinks menu on the rooftop would make things easier for the staff as they could have a fridge stocked and ready to serve. Also hubby ordered an internet connection (you say how long you want and they give you a print out with a code on it which you enter on your laptop etc )it seemed a bit of a complicated process and no one came to our room with the printout infact they handed it to him as we were leaving for dinner that evening (he had sat in the room waiting for it earlier!) Another tip would be to either book the hotel car to take you back to the airport or if you dont have much luggage just walk down to the spanish steps and grab a cab (they are always there) We asked the hotel to call us a cab and it took forever to come, we were beginning to worry we would miss our flight. However i have to say it was a lovely hotel all new and modern and very clean, the staff were really lovely and i am sure that when all the small hiccups are sorted out it will rival any of the top hotels in Rome (we sat one night drinking champagne in the bar at the Hassler and it seemed so old and musty compared to the Portrait Suites) When you check in they hand you a list of DVDs that are available to watch in your room (as only english speaking channels on TV are CNN and SKY news ) but the list is so dire i really dont know why they hand it out it is a big sheet of paper with about five films printed on it they all had a Rome theme i cant remember them all but Roman Holiday etc Not Gladiator, that should definately be on the list and i do think it wouldn't cost much to nip down the shop and put a few more decent blokbusters on the list. You do so much walking and eating in Rome its nice to go back to your beautiful room with huge flat screen tv and curl up and watch a movie. Anyway i only mention these small details because i am sure the hotel must check out its reviews and if they just improve on these small issues they will turn what is already a very good hotel into an excellent hotel. We had a fantastic time at the Portrait suites and i would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Charming and confortable suites”
Reviews.Author: Elisa&Leo-ontheroad
Reviews.Content: Just perfect! It's a Boutique Hotel, right up the Ferragamo shop, seems to be in their house. Actually it's not that easy to find it because it's in the little street Boccadileone, and not Via Condotti, and the name is "Portrait Suites". But once inside it's just outstanding. Rooms are very well equipped,high tech,and wonderful design, you can feel the Ferragamo touch. The guys at the reception are great, Gianluca,Chiara,Irene, they will help you out in the best way. The terrace on the 7th floor it's so cool!!!! definitely a great place!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: clambake33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September of 2006. The hotel is located in the shopping district in Rome and it is just a couple of blocks from the Spanish Steps. It is walking distance to many of the sites in Rome. I have travelled alot and stayed in many fabulous hotels. This hotel stands out because of the wonderful service and comfort and beauty of the rooms. The interior was designed by the Ferragamo folks. It was modern, beautiful, spacious and luxurious. The bed and bath were tremendous. The staff of the hotel went out of their way to make our stay the best. They took enormous pride in their service. They arranged for marvelous restaurants, (we always sat in the best table), private guides, taxis and maps. They spoke wonderful English and always had a smile on their face. Outstanding! We will never stay at another place in Rome!
